current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To provide for offices on sexual assault prevention and
		  response under the Chiefs of Staff of the Armed Forces, to require reports on
		  additional offices and selection of sexual assault prevention and response
		  personnel, and for other purposes.

cosponsor.#tail:
) introduced the
			 following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

header.#text:
Offices and personnel for
			 sexual assault prevention and response within the Armed Forces

Offices under
			 Chiefs of Staff of the Armed Forces required

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall establish and maintain within the office of such Chief of
			 Staff an office on the sexual assault prevention and response program carried
			 out by such Armed Force.

text.#text: Each Chief of Staff of an Armed Force specified in

The Chiefs of Staff of the Armed Forces specified in this
			 paragraph are as follows:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Chief of
			 Staff of the Army

Chief of
			 Staff of the Air Force

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
using the selection process used by the
			 Chief of Staff to fill nominative billets.

text.#text:
The
			 head of an office established under this subsection shall be selected by the
			 Chief of Staff concerned from among members of the Armed Forces and civilian
			 employees of the

The head of an office established under this subsection
			 shall be subject to the direct supervision of, and shall report directly to,
			 the Chief of Staff concerned regarding the activities of the office and the
			 sexual assault prevention and response program or programs of the Armed Force
			 concerned.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, who is selected for assignment
			 in such office to a position that includes responsibility for sexual assault
			 prevention and response within the Armed Forces is selected for assignment
			 using a selection process used to fill nominative billets.

text.#text:
The head of each office established under this subsection
			 shall ensure that any individual, whether a member of the Armed Forces or a
			 civilian employee of the

header.#text:
Selection of

			 process

Reports on
			 offices under the military departments

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Committees on Armed Services of the Senate

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
a
			 report setting forth an assessment of the feasibility and advisability of
			 establishing and maintaining within the office of such Secretary an office on
			 the sexual assault prevention and response program carried out by such military
			 department.

text.#text:
Not later than 90 days after the date of the enactment of

using the selection process used by such Secretary to

That the head of

That the head of

			 activities of the office and the sexual assault prevention and response program
			 or programs of the military department.

, who is selected for

text.#text:
That the head of
			 the office shall ensure that any individual, whether a member of the Armed
			 Forces or a civilian employee of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Committees on Armed Services of the Senate

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
a
			 report setting forth an assessment of the feasibility and advisability of
			 selecting the members of the Armed Forces and other personnel to be assigned to
			 positions under the jurisdiction of such Secretary that include responsibility
			 for sexual assault prevention and response within the Armed Forces, including
			 Sexual Assault Prevention and Response Coordinators and Sexual Assault
			 Prevention and Response Victim Advocates, through the selection process used by
			 such military department to fill nominative billets.
